result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Dierre Adams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon Dierre Adams appeared by video.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz appeared by video for Devon Dierre Adams.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Correspondence from Defendant. Discussion placed on the record. Defense moved to withdraw. Statements by Defendant. State took no position. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Court VACATED Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Case passed to October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 25, 2022; received and filed.

Defense contacted the Court via email regarding Defendant's request for new counsel.
Court will address Motion to Withdraw at the Final PreTrial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated September 20, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Scheduled Alternate Contact. 
Defendant REGAINED CONTACT with JusticePoint.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated August 15, 2022; received and filed.
GPS - Violation of Conditions.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated 08-04-22; received and filed.
"GPS"

Court MODIFIED DEFENDANT'S RELEASE. Court GRANTED Defendant EIGHT (8) HOURS for the following, grocery shopping/errands/childcare appointments. Court CONTINUED Defendants release for work/work search activities. Defendant must provide work information to JusticePoint. All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.
Court addressed JusticePoint Supervision Modification Notice. State complied with victim notification. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court MODIFIED CONDITIONS OF BAIL.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Defense advised the Court of possible Motion to Withdraw Counsel due to a breakdown in communication. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 9:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 21, 2022; received and filed.
JusticePoint Case Manager contacted the Court via email regarding request for bail to be addressed at Status hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated 07-19-22; received and filed.
"GPS"

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated July 12, 2022; received and filed.
GPS - Violation of Conditions.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in Court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Status hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 06-21-22; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 11CF1352. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Finkley.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated May 27, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in Court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Motion to Withdraw hearing. Defendant and Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Defendant's request for new counsel. Court held colloquy with Defendant. State took no position. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated May 19, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on military leave. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report- 04-29-2022

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated April 25, 2022; received and filed.
GPS Violation.

In addition to release for medical and legal appointments, Mr. Adams has release for the following:
1. work/work search.
2. grocery shopping/errands/childcare appointments. 
Mr. Adams must provide information/notice to JusticePoint. 
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in Court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. State requested to increase bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED State's Motion to Increase Bail, and Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail. Clerk provided information to JusticePoint. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 14, 2022; received and filed.

Case should have been scheduled TODAY (April 11, 2022) for Bail/Bond hearing. 
State did not comply with Victim Notification. 
NEW DATE: Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:45 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz; both appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present prior to the case being called. Witness is in trial in another court on another matter. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 4, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in Court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Public Defender's Office did NOT appear. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Defendant appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. State appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court appointed Attorney Nicholas Conrardy to represent Defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant DOES NOT REPAY the County. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Defendant requested to address JusticePoint Supervision. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am. Defendant can appear In-Person in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility or via Zoom Video Conference.

**CASE RE-CALLED.**
After the hearing was conducted, Public Defender's Office filed an Order Appointing Counsel (Attorney Martin Tanz). Court VACATED previous appointment of Attorney Conrardy.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Martin Tanz

**FILED AFTER THE ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE HEARING.**
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated March 18, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated March 3, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated February 4, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.A.M., B.A.L., N.C., B.C., A.H. and her children, L.R.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring 24 hour curfew.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Devon Dierre Adams in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon Dierre Adams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
